		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Full sun&lt;/SunExpose&gt;
		&lt;WaterReq&gt;Needs regular watering - weekly, or more often in extreme heat.&lt;/WaterReq&gt;
		&lt;Sun_exposure&gt;Full sun&lt;/Sun_exposure&gt;
		&lt;Water&gt;Moderate&lt;/Water&gt;
		&lt;CZoneHigh&gt;8&lt;/CZoneHigh&gt;
		&lt;CZoneLow&gt;4&lt;/CZoneLow&gt;
		&lt;SpecialFeatures&gt;Waterwise,Easy Care,Dwarf Plant,Dramatic Foliage Color,Deer Resistant&lt;/SpecialFeatures&gt;
		&lt;ProblemSolutions&gt;&lt;/ProblemSolutions&gt;
		&lt;LandscapeUses&gt;Mass Planting,Hedge,Firescaping/Fire Wise,Border,Barrier&lt;/LandscapeUses&gt;
	&lt;/Plant&gt;
&lt;/DataSync&gt;
</plantXML><username xsi:type="xsd:string">monrovia</username><password xsi:type="xsd:string">plants</password></tns:UpdatePlant></soap:Body></soap:Envelope>

		&lt;WaterReq&gt;Water regularly- weekly or more often in extreme heat. Requires less frequent watering, once established.&lt;/WaterReq&gt;
		&lt;Sun_exposure&gt;Full sun&lt;/Sun_exposure&gt;
		&lt;Water&gt;Moderate&lt;/Water&gt;

		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Reaches 12-18 in. tall, spreading 18-24 in. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Plant the crown at soil level in fertile, moist, well-drained soil. Best in a sheltered spot with full sun. After harvesting, prune off old leaves. Leave the crown and new leaves untouched to allow sunlight into the center of the plant.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;

		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Partial to full sun&lt;/SunExpose&gt;

		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Windbreak,Urban Garden,Privacy Screen,Poolside,Coastal Exposure,Rosemary (Rosmarinus); Lavender (Lavandula); Blue Mist Shrub (Caryopteris); Indian Hawthorn (Rhaphiolepis); Hydrangea (Hydrangea)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Very slow growing to 25 to 30 ft. tall, 3 ft. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Watering can be reduced after establishment. Feed with a general purpose fertilizer before new growth begins in spring.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;
		&lt;ContainerSize&gt;2&lt;/ContainerSize&gt;
		&lt;LegalVolume&gt;1.73 gal. (6.55 L)&lt;/LegalVolume&gt;

Excellent for formal plantings or to provide structure at the back of the border. Makes a wonderful topiary or container specimen.&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;

		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Moderate growing to 15 to 20 ft. tall and 15 ft. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Fertilize before new growth begins in spring. 		&lt;PriAttribute&gt;Summer Flowering&lt;/PriAttribute&gt;
		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Urban Garden,Specimen,Privacy Screen,Mass Planting,Firescaping/Fire Wise,Indian Hawthorn (Rhaphiolepis); Lilyturf (Liriope); Mexican Heather (Cuphea); Agapanthus (Agapanthus); Daylily (Hemerocallis)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Large shrub or small tree, moderate growing to 20 ft. tall and wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Feed with a general purpose fertilizer before new growth begins in spring. For a formal appearance, shear annually after flowering.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;
		&lt;ContainerSize&gt;5&lt;/ContainerSize&gt;

		&lt;ItemSizeID&gt;039991&lt;/ItemSizeID&gt;
		&lt;Item&gt;03999&lt;/Item&gt;
		&lt;SpecialIcon&gt;&lt;/SpecialIcon&gt;
		&lt;Size&gt;1&lt;/Size&gt;
		&lt;SizeDescription&gt;&lt;/SizeDescription&gt;
		&lt;Botanical&gt;Helleborus x hybridus &apos;Walhelivor&apos; P.P. #16,199&lt;/Botanical&gt;
		&lt;BotanicalShort&gt;Helleborus x hybridus &apos;Walhelivor&apos;&lt;/BotanicalShort&gt;
		&lt;CommonName&gt;Ivory Prince Lenten Rose&lt;/CommonName&gt;
		&lt;PriAttribute&gt;Early Spring Flowering&lt;/PriAttribute&gt;
		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Woodland Garden,Mass Planting,Border,Coral Bells (Heuchera); Columbine (Aquilegia); Hosta (Hosta); Lungwort (Pulmonaria); Bleeding Heart (Dicentra)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Forms basal clumps to 12 in. tall, spreads wider.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Provide well drained soil, rich in organic matter. Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Tolerates periodic dry spells, once established. Feed with an acid fertilizer after bloom. Keep roots cool with a thick layer of mulch.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;
		&lt;ContainerSize&gt;1&lt;/ContainerSize&gt;
		&lt;LegalVolume&gt;2.60 qt. (2.46 L)&lt;/LegalVolume&gt;
		&lt;UPC&gt;014949237410&lt;/UPC&gt;
		&lt;FlowerTime&gt;Early spring&lt;/FlowerTime&gt;
		&lt;PlantBenefits&gt;Deep pink buds open to bright white flowers that face up and outward from the plant, unlike many. This virtually problem-free perennial brings delightful spring color to woodland, native or shade gardens.&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;
		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Full shade to filtered sun&lt;/SunExpose&gt;
		&lt;WaterReq&gt;Water regularly- weekly or more often in extreme heat, until established.&lt;/WaterReq&gt;
		&lt;Sun_exposure&gt;Partial sun,Full shade&lt;/Sun_exposure&gt;
		&lt;Water&gt;Moderate&lt;/Water&gt;
		&lt;CZoneHigh&gt;9&lt;/CZoneHigh&gt;

		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Woodland Garden,Mass Planting,Border,Coral Bells (Heuchera); Columbine (Aquilegia); Hosta (Hosta); Lungwort (Pulmonaria); Bleeding Heart (Dicentra)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Forms basal clumps to 12 in. tall, spreads wider.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Provide well drained soil, rich in organic matter. Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Tolerates periodic dry spells, once established. Feed with an acid fertilizer after bloom. Keep roots cool with a thick layer of mulch.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;

		&lt;PriAttribute&gt;Shade Loving&lt;/PriAttribute&gt;
		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Woodland Garden,Mass Planting,Container,Border,Coral Bells (Heuchera); Columbine (Aquilegia); Hosta (Hosta); Lungwort (Pulmonaria); Bleeding Heart (Dicentra)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Reaches 18-22 in. tall, 20-24 in. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Provide well drained soil, rich in organic matter. 		&lt;UPC&gt;014949320334&lt;/UPC&gt;
		&lt;FlowerTime&gt;Peachy-apricot blooms appear early spring.&lt;/FlowerTime&gt;
		&lt;PlantBenefits&gt;From Marietta O&apos;Byrne&apos;s meticulous breeding program, this hybrid features varying shades of peachy-apricot blooms with darker rose veining, speckling or picotee edges. Emerging in early spring from vigorous clumps of foliage, these large, nodding flowers last for weeks.&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;
		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Full to partial shade&lt;/SunExpose&gt;

		&lt;UPC&gt;014949369258&lt;/UPC&gt;
		&lt;FlowerTime&gt;Peachy-apricot blooms appear early spring.&lt;/FlowerTime&gt;
		&lt;PlantBenefits&gt;From Marietta O&apos;Byrne&apos;s meticulous breeding program, this hybrid features varying shades of peachy-apricot blooms with darker rose veining, speckling or picotee edges. Emerging in early spring from vigorous clumps of foliage, these large, nodding flowers last for weeks.&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;
		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Full to partial shade&lt;/SunExpose&gt;
		&lt;WaterReq&gt;Water regularly in extreme heat; requires less once established.&lt;/WaterReq&gt;

Spreads slowly, forming clumps. Adds wonderful texture to natural and hillside plantings.&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;

Sun-tolerant Southern indica varieties thrive in full to dappled sun in cool northern climates; in hot summer areas provide morning sun with light afternoon shade. Evergreen&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;
		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Partial shade to full sun&lt;/SunExpose&gt;
		&lt;WaterReq&gt;Needs regular watering - weekly, or more often in extreme heat.&lt;/WaterReq&gt;

		&lt;PriAttribute&gt;Fall Flowering&lt;/PriAttribute&gt;
		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Very Wet Areas,Firescaping/Fire Wise,Blanket Flower (Gaillardia); Black-Eyed-Susan (Rudbeckia); Coneflower (Echinacea); Blue Fescue (Festuca); Shasta Daisy (Chrysanthemum)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Fast growing to 16 in. tall, 12 to 14 in. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. For a neat appearance, remove old foliage before new leaves emerge. Divide clumps every 2 to 3 years in early spring.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;

		&lt;BotanicalShort&gt;Aronia arbutifolia &apos;Brilliantissima&apos;&lt;/BotanicalShort&gt;
		&lt;CommonName&gt;Brilliant Red Chokeberry&lt;/CommonName&gt;
		&lt;PriAttribute&gt;Fall Color&lt;/PriAttribute&gt;
		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Very Wet Areas,Firescaping/Fire Wise,Snowberry (Symphoricarpos); Beautyberry (Callicarpa); Dogwood (Cornus); Oregon Grape Holly (Mahonia); Burning Bush (Euonymus)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Slow growing to 6 to 8 ft. tall and wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish an extensive root system. Feed regularly during the growing season with a general purpose fertilizer. Prune annually in late winter to promote vigorous new growth.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;
		&lt;ContainerSize&gt;B&amp;amp;B&lt;/ContainerSize&gt;
		&lt;LegalVolume&gt;&lt;/LegalVolume&gt;
		&lt;UPC&gt;014949267837&lt;/UPC&gt;
		&lt;FlowerTime&gt;Spring&lt;/FlowerTime&gt;
		&lt;PlantBenefits&gt;An improved, compact selection noted for its brilliant red fall foliage and larger, more abundant glossy red fruit. Tart and bitter fruit causes choking if eaten fresh, but good for jams and jellies. Deciduous.&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;
		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Partial to full sun&lt;/SunExpose&gt;
		&lt;WaterReq&gt;Water regularly in extreme heat for best performance. Requires less water once established.&lt;/WaterReq&gt;
		&lt;Sun_exposure&gt;Full sun,Partial sun&lt;/Sun_exposure&gt;
		&lt;Water&gt;Moderate&lt;/Water&gt;

		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Fast growing stems 6 to 8 ft. long.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Water regularly during the first growing season to establish a deep extensive root system. Feed with a general purpose fertilizer. Provide the support of a trellis or arbor. 		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. For a neat appearance, remove old foliage before new leaves emerge. Divide clumps every 2 to 3 years in early spring.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;

		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Reaches 14-16 in. tall and 12-14 in. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;

		&lt;ContainerSize&gt;1&lt;/ContainerSize&gt;
		&lt;LegalVolume&gt;2.60 qt. (2.46 L)&lt;/LegalVolume&gt;

		&lt;FlowerTime&gt;Golden yellow flowers in summer&lt;/FlowerTime&gt;
		&lt;PlantBenefits&gt;Huge, bright golden yellow, daisy like flowers have sunny gold centers and contrast nicely with shimmery silver and green foliage. Compact habit, with blooms from mid through late season. Provides a nice splash of color during the heat of the summer. A great cut flower!&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;
		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Full sun&lt;/SunExpose&gt;
		&lt;WaterReq&gt;Needs regular watering - weekly, or more often in extreme heat.&lt;/WaterReq&gt;

		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Reaches 12-18 in. tall and 18-24 in. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;

		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Moderate grower to 8 to 12 in. tall, 3 to 6 ft. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;

		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Urban Garden,Specimen,Mass Planting,Firescaping/Fire Wise,Indian Hawthorn (Rhaphiolepis); Lilyturf (Liriope); Mexican Heather (Cuphea); Agapanthus (Agapanthus); Daylily (Hemerocallis)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Moderate growing to rounded dome 15 ft. tall, 14 ft. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Feed with a general purpose fertilizer before new growth begins in spring. For a formal appearance, shear annually after flowering.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;
		&lt;ContainerSize&gt;QT&lt;/ContainerSize&gt;

		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Moderate growing to rounded dome 15 ft. tall, 14 ft. wide.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;

Thin young trees in late winter to early spring, leaving 3-7 main trunks or canopy branches. On older trees, prune only to remove suckers that have emerged from main trunks or ground.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;

		&lt;CompanionPlantDescription&gt;Woodland Garden,Very Wet Areas,Urban Garden,Specimen,Border,Forsythia (Forsythia); Dogwood (Cornus); Clethra (Clethra); Bee Balm (Monarda); Turtlehead (Chelone)&lt;/CompanionPlantDescription&gt;
		&lt;AvgLandscapeSize&gt;Fast-growing 15 to 20 ft. high and wide; maintain at 6 to 10 ft. with vigorous pruning.&lt;/AvgLandscapeSize&gt;
		&lt;CareInstructions&gt;Follow a regular watering schedule during the first growing season to establish a deep, extensive root system. Watering can be reduced after establishment. Feed with a general purpose fertilizer before new growth begins in spring.&lt;/CareInstructions&gt;
		&lt;ContainerSize&gt;10&lt;/ContainerSize&gt;
		&lt;LegalVolume&gt;7.97 gal. (30.17 L)&lt;/LegalVolume&gt;

		&lt;PlantBenefits&gt;Weeping branches display striking pink stems and buds, surrounded by foliage mottled in white, green and pink highlights. The brightly colored stems provide excellent winter interest. This graceful shrub is a perfect garden accent. Deciduous.&lt;/PlantBenefits&gt;
		&lt;SunExpose&gt;Partial to full sun&lt;/SunExpose&gt;
